Exaggerate: The claim falsely states that Sheriff Joe Arpaio will take over John McCain's seat in the Senate, which is an exaggerated claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that John McCain's replacement in the Senate has not been appointed yet.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up its assertion that Sheriff Joe Arpaio will replace John McCain.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Sheriff Joe Arpaio will be appointed to the Senate without any factual basis or confirmation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the Arizona Governor will appoint McCain's replacement, not Sheriff Joe Arpaio.
